etymology.description: 功(achievement; skill) + 夫(suffix ‘man’ > nominalizer) = skill gained through effort; later narrowed to martial arts.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the idea of achievement/work with a nominal element to mean skill developed over time and effort. Via Cantonese gung1 fu1 and English, it came to denote Chinese martial arts specifically.

examples.chinese: 他每天练功夫(他每天練功夫)。
examples.english: He practices kung fu every day.

examples.chinese: 她的功夫很高(她的功夫很高)。
examples.english: Her kung fu skills are excellent.

examples.chinese: 我没功夫聊天(我沒功夫聊天)。
examples.english: I don’t have time to chat.
